page.name: Step 1: PrewritingÂ
page.content:
Prewriting can incorporate sketches, words, phrases, and bullet lists.  Any technique that allows your learners to start to understand the content of their story. Ask learners to reflect on (but not write about) the following questions: 

  • What is the time frame of your story? Is it from birth until the present, or is it a month of your life, or even a particular day?
  • What are the points about your story that are most important for you to share?
  • What makes a good life story? 

You can also model brainstorming and prewriting for your learners by drawing your own timeline. Consider making a timeline of your learning journey and encouraging learners to start with their own timeline.
